title: How to Help Minorities Buy Their First Home
sub_head: Special Purpose Credit Programs can provide lenders with an effective way to serve minority groups who do not have access to generational wealth.
body:
Regarding “Fannie Mae’s New Racial Bias” (Review & Outlook, June 14): The racial homeownership gap between white and black households today, according to the U.S. Census Bureau, is wider than it was when the Fair Housing Act was passed in 1968.
Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac ’s recently announced Equitable Housing Finance Plans include the commitment to expand the use of Special Purpose Credit Programs (SPCPs).
